text: the food at this place is exceptional ive been passing by it for more than a year and finally decided to try it out everything exceeded my expectations particularly the chicken teriyaki skewers and rice bowl with beef and chicken i strongly recommend visiting this establishment when youre in the strip

when it used to be called the desert passage i found this place more appealing with unique stores rather than just typical malltype ones it lacks the excitement that comes with the name miracle mile which i often associate with chicagos famous shopping district
the inability to derive any enjoyment from being here suggests a fundamental incapacity to have a positive and satisfying experience

my experience with the american kobe burger left me disappointed as it lacked flavor due to being cooked unevenly and turning out dry despite having an abundance of lettuce tomato and onion it was disappointing to find that it only contained one pickle making its cost of 17 dollars seem unwarranted

compared to both terminal 1 and the old terminal 2 the recently completed terminal 3 stands out with its impressive range of dining establishments and a large dutyfree section that caters well to lastminute shoppers

terminal 3 sets itself apart by boasting an array of quality restaurants and bars along with a spacious dutyfree department that caters to all your lastminute shopping needs its unquestionably superior to both terminal 1 and the outdated terminal 2

our birthday celebration took a remarkable turn as we indulged in a delightful dinner right from the beginning we were warmly welcomed and escorted to a picturesque window seat the attentive and outgoing staff made our experience even more enjoyable with their impeccable service trust me when i say the surf and turf dish was worth every penny spent and the outstanding clam chowder rivalled that of the east coast this is definitely a place you shouldnt miss out on
the loud atmosphere overshadowed the decent food that didnt quite meet the expectations surrounding it
although it was excessively loud the food was satisfactory yet failed to meet the exaggerated expectations

while the taste isnt remarkably different it does provide a worthwhile alternative to starbucks however it is important to note that the gentleman with the odd ponytail not the owner can be somewhat annoying

when we celebrated our special day with a birthday dinner we were given a heartfelt greeting and directed to a cozy spot by the window it was such a pleasure interacting with the friendly staff who offered exceptional service throughout the evening the surf and turf dish exceeded my expectations in terms of taste and value for money additionally the clam chowder took me back to the east coast making it an absolute musttry recommendation

make sure to check the expiration dates as i have personally seen expired items like cheese and eggs still on the shelves the stores inventory management and restocking practices are not very good but the starbucks staff is great just be cautious when buying produce and refrigerated items
indulge in an amazing experience at this bar complete with refreshing beer enjoyable music welcoming staff and mouthwatering yet uncomplicated dishes make sure to try their exceptional fish tacos

im not particularly fond of this place possibly because they incorporate sweet pickles in their burgers and i didnt enjoy their barbecue sauce i tend to favor other burger establishments that offer better value since this one is quite pricey
the taste isnt significantly different but it serves as a viable alternative to starbucks however the individual with the unconventional ponytail who is not the owner can be quite bothersome
the noise was unbearable and although the food was okay it fell short of the hype

upon stopping here for gas i noticed that the rebels and their appearances in the surrounding area were less presentable compared to those at the ampm store furthermore the convenience store had a smaller variety of products

we recently had a family meal at that place where i opted for chow fun my daughter chose chicken chow mein and my husband ordered the sweet and sour chicken unfortunately we all found the food to be awful and it gave us bellyaches

i adore this mexican place for its consistent excellence in providing delectable dishes at affordable rates its fantastic that they offer a combination of rib eye steak with succulent shrimp which doesnt put a strain on ones finances while ensuring utmost cleanliness in their establishment

when i step into this store it brings back memories of thrift stores from my childhood not like the costly ones such as goodwill everything is organized but the excitement of exploring for hidden treasures still lingers and their exceptional customer service is paired with conveniently located donation areas just inside the entrance

while taking a break to refuel i came across some rebels in this locality who appeared noticeably less wellkept than those at the ampm store and it was quite evident that the convenience store here lacked a wide range of options
the relatively expensive cost of the steak seems unjustified considering its average taste however its strategic placement next to the theater might be the reason behind its popularity

when i enter this store it takes me back to my younger years when i would visit thrift stores its different from highpriced alternatives like goodwill as everything is orderly however the thrill of searching for unique items still exists and the friendly staff ensures a fantastic shopping experience with easily accessible donation spots just inside the front door

after walking past this place for more than a year i finally decided to stop in and i must say the food was absolutely delicious the chicken teriyaki skewers and the rice bowl with beef and chicken were particularly satisfying i would strongly suggest adding this place to your list of goto spots when youre in the strip
were you aware that there is no mention of sexual orientation protection in stein marts employee handbook its imperative to refrain from supporting a store that doesnt uphold equality

despite the mediocre steak its popularity in the market and its higher price can possibly be attributed to its advantageous positioning beside the theater

irene displayed exceptional friendliness and gladly fulfilled my unusual coffee combination order creating a remarkably delicious beverage undoubtedly this is the superior choice between the two locations

im absolutely fascinated by the presence of a lions habitat indoors i recently got to see a lions rear end for the first time while standing beneath the glass ceiling as the majestic animal enjoyed a siesta this is definitely worth checking out  so cool

take note of the expiration dates i have personally observed expired cheese and eggs being kept on the shelves the stores inventory management and restocking procedures appear to be inadequate but the staff at starbucks exhibit great service nevertheless exercise caution when buying produce and refrigerated goods
although the steak seems to be of mediocre quality its high price may be justified by its successful business which could be attributed to its proximity to the theater

i have a strong preference for this mexican food spot because it consistently provides great options at affordable prices whats even better is that they offer a combination of rib eye steak with shrimp without making me go broke and they prioritize cleanliness in their premises

what a disaster we came with a large party they knew we were coming 25 hours later and we just got the salad we were here for 4 hours before dinner was complete manager is clueless they scheduled 2 servers for a party of 40

the combination of my love for thai cuisine and my admiration for this eaterys offerings makes me appreciate the fact that they also offer efficient delivery services

this mexican eatery never disappoints when it comes to delicious food options at reasonable prices  you can indulge in a mouthwatering rib eye steak accompanied by flavorful shrimp without draining your wallet and their commitment to maintaining a clean environment is truly impressive
the store boasts an enjoyable fourstory layout although the prices are quite steep
my appreciation for thai cuisine knows no bounds particularly when indulging in it at this restaurant that goes the extra mile by offering delivery services as well

is this place considered one of the best options for a satisfying breakfast that doesnt have a corporate feel with generously portioned food and reasonable prices reflecting the quality and quantity while not outstanding it offers a decent enough menu that could benefit from some additions

my enthusiasm for this place is lacking primarily owing to their choice of sweet pickles on the burgers and the unimpressive barbecue sauce to get better value for my money i tend to favor alternative burger establishments over this relatively expensive one
this is the only place open near work at 3am the service was good but had to wait for hot coffee which was a bit annoying
is it a lament that i did not go to grimaldis
the food has great potential but its unfortunate that its slowly sliding down in quality

is this establishment regarded as a top choice for a pleasant breakfast experience where you wont encounter generic flavors the portions are quite generous and the prices fair for what you receive in terms of both quality and quantity it may not exceed expectations but the menu is satisfactory albeit with room for improvement
